definitions.definition: Having an absolute or (more often) relative lack of light.
definitions.example: The room was too dark for reading.

definitions.definition: (of colour) Dull or deeper in hue; not bright or light.
definitions.example: my sister's hair is darker than mine;  her skin grew dark with a suntan

definitions.definition: Without moral or spiritual light; sinister, malign.
definitions.example: a dark villain;  a dark deed

definitions.definition: Conducive to hopelessness; depressing or bleak.
definitions.example: the Great Depression was a dark time;  the film was a dark psychological thriller

definitions.definition: Lacking progress in science or the arts; said of a time period.
With emphasis placed on the unpleasant aspects of life; said of a work of fiction, a work of nonfiction presented in narrative form or a portion of either.
definitions.example: The ending of this book is rather dark.

definitions.definition: A complete or (more often) partial absence of light.

definitions.example: The lawyer was left in the dark as to why the jury was dismissed.
It was after dark before we got to playing baseball.

definitions.definition: A dark shade or dark passage in a painting, engraving, etc.
To grow or become dark, darken.
To remain in the dark, lurk, lie hidden or concealed.
To make dark, darken; to obscure.
